problem_text:
For a finite group G, let χ1(G) denote the totality of the degrees of all irreducible complex characters of G with allowance for their multiplicities. Suppose that H is a finite group with χ1(H) = χ1(G).
a) If G is an almost simple group, must H be isomorphic to G?
b) If G is a quasisimple group, must H be isomorphic to G?
This is true if G is a simple group (see 11.8(a) in Archive).
A. Iranmanesh, F. Shirjian
